result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jovan Tevon Mitchell

records.addlTxt: $500.00 Cash bail to remain. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Jovan Tevon Mitchell in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Jovan Tevon Mitchell.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 30.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 10-20-2022.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for status conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.

Defendant Jovan Tevon Mitchell in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jovan Tevon Mitchell appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant had audio and video issues and the hearing could not conducted. Court ordered case to be set for an in-person hearing.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Jovan Tevon Mitchell in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has received discovery. Court is advised of global offer. Defense requests more time. Case adjourned to Br. 30.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, received and filed.

22RM023651  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
5/1/2022
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
Tashera M E, Center Street Library and
Have no contact with the area within the physical boundaries set forth below:
WestNorth 30th Street
EastN. 23rd Street
SouthW. Meinecke Ave
NorthWest Hadley Street
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jovan Tevon Mitchell in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Jovan Tevon Mitchell in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jovan Tevon Mitchell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
